drinks.name: Boozy Hot Chocolate
ingredients: 1 packet of hot chocolate of choice
Milk/milk substitute to the hot chocolate instructions
Roughly 1 shot of flavored Rumchata of choice
steps: Prepare the hot chocolate per packaging direction (preferably using milk, not water) and add as much Rumchata as you want!
Unwrap the candy cane and use it as a drink stirrer, letting it dissolve for more flavor
Top with marshmallows
drinks.mocktail: Remove Rumchata, add in either peppermint syrup or flavored coffee creamer.

drinks.name: El Gregorita
ingredients: 2 oz. of homemade jalapeño-infused tequila (preferably Casamigos with a jalapeño and its seeds infused for about 10 hours)
steps: Dip the rim of your glass in freshly squeezed lime juice and then dip the glass rim in rock salt
Fill glass halfway with ice before adding all of your ingredients
Stir and enjoy!
drinks.mocktail: Infuse Topo Chico with jalapeño and replace tequila above, keep the rest the same.
drinks.glassware: A rocks glass (a.k.a. an old fashioned glass or a lowball glass) will do the trick, hell a solo cup will work. It's the liquid that's gold!

drinks.name: Apple Cider Mimosa
ingredients: Caramel and cinnamon sugar for rimming (optional)
steps: Dip the rim of the Champagne glass in caramel and then dip in cinnamon sugar for a coated rim. It's ok if the caramel drips down into the glass, it'll make it even more delicious!
In a cocktail shaker, combine one part apple cider and one part vodka. Shake with ice. Pour into the rimmed Champagne glass + top with champagne.
Enjoy!
drinks.mocktail: Swap out the caramel vodka for a drizzle of caramel and swap the champagne for sparkling water.

drinks.name: Milk Punch
ingredients: 2 oz. milk (preferably Calder’s or a higher quality one)
steps: Combine all ingredients except the nutmeg in a cocktail shaker with ice
Shake it up
Pour over rocks
Dust with nutmeg
drinks.mocktail: You could take the bourbon out, but then it’s just milk and nutmeg, and that seems kinda gross. Honestly, a mocktail version might just be a glass of milk.

drinks.name: Tipsy Mermaid
steps: Add ingredients to a glass of crushed ice.
Stir!
drinks.mocktail: Substitute 2 oz. of gin for a splash of tonic water and 1/2 oz. of juniper berry or elderflower syrup.

drinks.name: Blood Orange Margarita
ingredients: 1.5 parts sweet & sour - DO NOT substitute margarita mix
Splash of Grand Marnier, plus extra for serving
steps: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the tequila, sweet & sour mix, Grand Marnier, juice from 1/4 lime and juice of 1/4 blood orange
Shake to combine
Pour the drink into a glass and garnish with juice/wedge of the lime & blood orange
drinks.mocktail: Replace tequila with soda or non-alcoholic tequila, replace Grand Marnier with orange juice.

drinks.name: Maple Old Fashioned
ingredients: 2 oz. bourbon or rye (Buffalo Trace is a good one for this)
steps: Combine whiskey, maple syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker with ice
Shake until well chilled
Pour over ice in a nice crystal tumbler
Garnish with orange peel and a cherry
drinks.mocktail: The internet says you can brew barley tea, or there are whiskey substitutes.

drinks.name: The Henry
steps: In the bottom of a glass, muddle two mint leaves
Mix all ingredients into glass
Serve over ice

drinks.name: The Hybrid
steps: Using a zester or paring knife, slice peel from lemon and orange in a long, thin spiral. Reserve lemon for another use and set peel aside.

In a cocktail shaker, combine gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled Champagne flute and top with sparkling wine. Pour a small amount of Aperol over top.
Curl lemon and orange peel around finger to create twist at least 6 inches long. Garnish the drink with a twist and serve immediately.
drinks.mocktail: Replace gin and champagne with 3 oz. soda water, add 1/4 oz. orange juice, freshly squeezed.

drinks.name: Cozy Spiced Old Fashioned
steps: Add maple syrup, water, and bitters to the bottom of a rocks glass.
Add ice and bourbon and stir for 30 seconds.
Rub orange peel around rim of glass, sprinkle with cinnamon, ginger, and cardamom and drop it in.
Finish with a cinnamon stick and enjoy
drinks.mocktail: Replace whiskey with a non-alcoholic brand (Ritual Zero Proof, Lyre's American Malt) or equal parts spiced or barley tea.

drinks.name: Cucumber Collins
steps: In the bottom of a mixing glass, muddle: 4-5 cucumber slices, 1 small mint leaf, 1 oz. lemon juice, 1 oz. simple syrup.
Add 2 oz. gin, along with ice, and shake.
Strain over fresh ice into a tall glass, then top with soda.
Garnish with mint leaves.

drinks.name: White Russian
steps: Pour vodka into glass (preferably over ice)
Add Kahlúa
Pour milk or cream over it
Drink is about 50% vodka, 30-40% Kahlúa, 10-20% cream or milk (I just do a splash of cream or milk to change the color, but this is usually how it is prepared).
Milk can make the drink curdle a bit (depending on the kind of milk being used) so, if that is an issue, cream is definitely the go to!
drinks.mocktail: Swap the vodka for 2 oz. dry sparkling vanilla soda.
